cont.entity_a: N connection to the desktop has issues with constant dropped signals and lock-ups.
cont.entity_b: Wireless security settings can cause connectivity issues. Product is not reliable and often disconnects.

cont.entity_a: Well-made and from a reputable brand, Cisco.
cont.entity_b: Product is not supported by Linksys anymore.

cont.entity_a: Installation was easy with a desktop connected at 130 to 260 Mbps and a notebook at 54 Mbps. Setup utility initially struggled to find the router, requiring manual IP configuration. Installation was straightforward and it works well with all wireless devices. Installation is easy, but router lacks range and has frequent disconnects. Setup should be done online rather than using the provided installation disk.
cont.entity_b: Installation wizard on CD does not work effectively. Product is difficult to install and requires technical knowledge. Installation is difficult, requiring manual intervention.

cont.entity_a: Signal quality varies from excellent to good inside an apartment. Works well across multiple rooms and floors in a house. Not powerful enough to cover a whole brick house. Good range and connection with no dropped signals. Router has good range, but not as advertised.
cont.entity_b: Wireless mode is unreliable with choppy sound.

cont.entity_a: Range extender incompatibility with N and G models.
cont.entity_b: Product is not compatible with Windows Vista. Product is not compatible with modern operating systems. Product lacks support for modern operating systems. Product is not compatible with 64-bit Vista.

cont.entity_a: Router is fast and comparable to wired connections. Good speed improvement over older wired routers. Good range and speed, but lacks gigabit connectivity. Router is fast with easy setup for those familiar with IP configurations.

Adding a computer requires running a Linksys program, which is secure but annoying. Firmware update with DD-WRT enhanced performance and functionality. Initial wireless connection drops were resolved by adjusting frequency settings. Manual setup is preferred.
cont.entity_b: Product performs well once set up correctly. Setup is challenging, but product performs well once configured.

cont.entity_a: Good customer service from Linksys. Poor documentation and support from Linksys.
cont.entity_b: Lacks manufacturer support and firmware updates. Technical support is insufficient.

cont.entity_a: Some units have high failure rates. Requires periodic power recycling and eventually stopped working. Product became obsolete quickly.
cont.entity_b: Product is not reliable and often disconnects.

cont.entity_a: Router worked right out of the box with WPA encryption. Firmware upgrades and manual settings may improve performance. Product works well but requires advanced setup for optimal performance.
cont.entity_b: Product works well in wireless mode with some setup challenges. Product can cause issues with existing wireless networks.

cont.entity_a: Reset button is inconveniently located, causing accidental resets. Dim LED lights are difficult to see.
cont.entity_b: Software design is poor, causing annoyance during use. Digital coax cable jack is recessed too deep for some cables.
Product information is outdated, not mentioning compatibility with modern OS.
